structure.unit: ARTICLE III. SOUTH FLORIDA FIRE PREVENTION CODE

law.catch_line: Repeal of conflicting or inconsistent municipal and County laws.

text.section:
Sec. 14-47. Repeal of conflicting or inconsistent municipal and County laws.
This article and the South Florida Fire Prevention Code are intended and shall be construed as constituting minimum standards for all governmental units in Dade County with respect to fire prevention and safety standards, in accordance with the provisions of(A)(18) of the Home Rule Charter of Government for Dade County, Florida. To the extent of the minimum standards herein provided, all County and municipal ordinance, County and municipal resolutions, municipal charters, special laws applying only to Dade County or any general law which the County Commission is authorized by the constitution to supersede, nullify or amend, and any part of any such ordinance, resolution, charter, or law in conflict with or inconsistent with the minimum fire prevention and safety standards herein established are hereby repealed and superseded.
